intro: Schefflera avenis var. cinnameociliata, commonly known as the variegated schefflera, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It features glossy, dark green leaves with striking white and yellow variegation, which adds visual interest to indoor spaces. The plant has a compact, bushy growth habit with multiple stems emerging from the base. Its leaves are palmate, consisting of 5–7 leaflets radiating from a central point. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
